result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Benjamin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).
  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
BOTH COUNTS: Provide DNA sample. Pay all mandatory costs, fees and assessments, including paying for DNA surcharge during the course of probation. Failure to pay will result in civil judgment or tax intercept. Court WAIVED all non mandatory costs and fees due to an inability to pay. Pay supervision fees as determined by the Dept. of Corrections.
- Restitution set at $0.00.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- No new violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Defendant to have No Contact with firearms.

- Cooperate with agent as to all home and office visits.
- Obtain a Mental Health Evaluation and cooperate with any treatment.
- Comply with Sex Offender Registration.

- Obtain an AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
- Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with count 2; with credit for 179 days served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Benjamin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin Benjamin in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Kevin Benjamin. Assistant District Attorney Brittany Skye Kachingwe in court for State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Pursuact to negotiations, Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 2:  
Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 179 days served.
AS TO COUNT 3:  
Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT with count 2, with credit for 179 days served.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: The Court stayed sentence and placed defendant on probation for a period of 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
*No new violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
*Cooperate with agent as to all home and office visits
*Obtain a mental health evaluation and cooperate with any treatment.
*Obtain an AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
*Submit to random urine screens.
*Comply with sex offender registration.
*Provide DNA sample as to both counts.
*Defendant to have no contact with firearms
*Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
*Pay all mandatory costs, fees and assessments, including paying for DNA surcharge during the course of probation.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment or tax intercept..

Court WAIVED all non mandatory costs and fees due to an inability to pay.
Restitution set at $0.00


Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Kevin Benjamin not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Kevin Benjamin.  Prosecuting attorney Brittany Skye Kachingwe in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant's appearance waived.  Discovery and Offer received, defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned in Br 45.  mn
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court, defendant Kevin Benjamin not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discovery and Offer received by defense.  Defense is requesting an adjourned date for scheduling to review.  Court granted adjourned date.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.   mn  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Benjamin in court by video with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland who appears in person.  Defendant Kevin Benjamin in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Sex Offender Registry Specialist - M. Lukach.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Attorney Brett Copeland

Defendant Kevin Benjamin not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Benjamin not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Kevin Benjamin in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Kevin Benjamin in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Benjamin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1 and 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
